data.title: NuGet packages for Network projects.
data.body:
I tried using the NuGet packages and I can't seem to find the "_.Net._" dll.
I think they should be included, because GamerServices and Guide are inside this assemblies.
At least there should be a second separate NuGet package for the Network assemblies.

data.title: SpriteBatch: Any changes 3.2 to 3.3?
Removed Old Content Pipeline
data.body: MonoGame 3.3 got released so I really wanted to sync up dependencies. Hopefully I did everything right for  #3390, tho I'll probably still have to fix some error that will occur.

data.title: Post release fixed for NuSpec packages
data.body:
While publishing the 3.3 NuGets, a few tweaks were needed to the NuSpec definitions.

All tested with released 3.3 packages

data.title: Updated Assembly version number for dev release (post 3.3 release)
data.body:
Noticed (a little too late) that the assembly version on the branch wasn't updated on release.

Verified that Official release did version the dll's correctly, so this is just a tidy up

Updated to 3.3.1.0

data.title: Buttons.LeftThumbstickUp incorrectly returns true when left stick pushed down
data.body: On Windows 7 with latest development build.  Xbox360-compatible joystick in USB port.  Buttons.LeftThunbstickUp returns true when the left stick is pushed DOWN(back) instead of when it is pushed up(forward).

data.title: Fixed touch capability on Windows 8
data.body: For some reason TouchPresent was zero on my Surface Pro 3 with the keyboard and a bluetooth mouse. Checking individual pointer devices works.

data.title: Release 3.3
data.body: This is a merge of the latest develop changes into master for the 3.3 release.

data.title: Dead link to Monogame Starterkits in README.md
data.body:
The link to [Monogame Starterkits](https://github.com/kungfubanana/MonoGame-StarterKits) is dead.

Dead URL: https://github.com/kungfubanana/MonoGame-StarterKits

Possible replacement URL: https://github.com/KonajuGames/MonoGame-StarterKits

The possible replacement repo hasn't been updated in 3 years, so I don't know how suitable a substitute it is.

data.title: Linux Installer Update
data.body:
Things done:
  • Added automatic dependency installer, currently only for Ubuntu 14.04 and 14.10
  • Added better mime type support

data.title: Pipeline: Content file icons should change based on file type
data.body:
It would be somewhat useful to display different icons in the content tree based on file type. For example, an FBX file could have a different icon than a PNG file, to make it easy to distinguish the two.

I haven't yet found a decent free set of icons for the purpose.

data.title: Implement VertexTextures and VertexSamplerStates for Direct3D
data.body:
Matches XNA API for vertex textures, including `GraphicsDevice.VertexTextures` and `GraphicsDevice.VertexSamplerStates`.

Fixes #2602, and partially replaces #2998.

data.title: Future of the PSM / Vita support
data.body:
Hello,

Sony has just announced that the Playstation Mobile program and the associated PS Vita market will be discontinued and shut down on september 10th (as well as the previously announced Android market shut down on july 15th).

Question is: what about MonoGame PS Vita support?

The announcement does not specify if the PSM SDK will be discontinued too, and since I am not (yet) a registered PS dev, I don't know if it is possible to use the PSM SDK to build PS Vita games through this program. But if it is, it may be interesting to keep PSM support and further develop it, which would make it a great addition to the PS4 support.

Official statement, japanese only: http://www.jp.playstation.com/info/support/sp_20150311_psm_info.html

data.title: Implement the Rg32
data.body:
Implement the `Rg32` packed vector struct.

See the docs for the type here:

 https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.graphics.packedvector.rg32.aspx

You can probably base the work off the existing [`HalfVector2`](https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/PackedVector/HalfVector2.cs) type as it is also a two 16bit component type.

We should add new unit tests for the type as well:

 https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/Test/Framework/PackedVectorTest.cs

data.title: Gtk Pipeline folder stuff
data.body:
Notes:
  • Adds "New Folder" and "Add Folder" options.
  • When adding a folder if the folder is not in the same directory as the base, a dialog will show asking to copy or to link
  • Undoing either action will not delete files, again, leaving that to the user
  • Actions are only connected to Gtk Pipeline, Windows Pipeline will act like before
I have one more PR for Gtk Pipeline after this and then I'll try to get Winforms pipeline up to date.

data.title: +Basic Drag&Drop functionality for MGCB
data.body:
Have a look please.
Definitely not 100%.
Folders are not implemented for example.
But I didn't know how to handle them (e.g. not allow them at all?, go and add everything recursively? ..)

Anyway, this might be a basic starting point I think.

data.title: Vector docs
data.body:
-Rewrited Vector2 docs - removed "see = cref>Vector2" routines and place simple "vector" instead.
-Fully documented Vector3 based on Vector2 translation.
-Optimization in few places in Vector3 -> New tests for Vector3.
-Few Vector4 docs.

data.title: Use PngWriter in Texture2D.PlatformSaveAsPng method on Windows, Mac and iOS
data.body: Not sure whether to place this in the Texture2D.SaveAsPng method or the Texture2D.OpenGL.PlatformSaveAsPng method.  Opted for the latter.

data.title: SpriteBatch.DrawCount property
data.body: This is addition to SpriteBatch which is ulong value which will increase every DrawInternal call. Useful for debugging purposes and performance increasing. The value is unchecked so it is defended from overflow exception.

data.title: Merge pull request #1 from mono/develop
data.body: Update to latest version

data.title: [Solution]Monogame PSM not rendering texture
monogame 3.2.99 issue on IOS setrendertarget
data.body:
Hi there seems to be an urgent issue with MonoGame 3.2.99 on ios.
I created a game (Lost!) for wp and ported it successfully to android. the gamr uses 2 rendertexture2d and a pixel shader which seen to work fine on wp/Android.

I'm currently porting it to ios and it seems that graphicsdevice.setrendertarget is causing the screen to go black. main screens don't have this issue because im outputting it without setting a rendertarget.
if i remove the lighting shader and not use rendertextyre2d the game works normally, but without all effects.

Is this a known issue since i didn't find it specifically when going through the reported bugs. and more important, will or can it be fixed?

best regards Sahin

data.title: no "MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Windows.csproj" file
data.body:
Just downloaded the latest source.

Double clicked the Win.sln.
VS couldn't open the project MonoGame.Framework.Conrent.Pipeline.Windows.

According to the sln file, the .csproj should be in projRoot\MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline\ but there is no csproj there.

I think the WindowsGL proj is in the same boat too.

data.title: Protobuild doesn't build the Monogame.Framework.Net project file for PSM
data.body:
And as a result I can't get my game running on PSM because it requires GamerServices... 

Please refer to this thread:
http://community.monogame.net/t/is-gamerservices-supported-on-psm/2052/4

data.title: GamePadState.IsButtonDown Ignores joystick deadzones.
data.body:
Not sure how to do a pull request since there's 2 months worth of commits inbetween, maybe cherry pick it?
https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/commit/63e2bf2c1e93f0f5b64e3ad57579790c96e9d934

Basically the bits for LeftThumbstickLeft, etc. are already set when the GamePadState is created in
https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Input/GamePad.SDL.cs#L305

I haven't checked the other platform GamePads, but at the least, the virtual thumbstick buttons should take joystick deadzones into account.

data.title: WP8.1 crash/freeze when IsfixedTimestep=true
data.body:
Hi!

WP8.1 crashes in the Tick function of Game.cs, exactly in the line 

```
Task.Delay(sleepTime).Wait();
```

more info here : http://community.monogame.net/t/wp8-1-game-freezes-sporadically/1865/13

stack trace + exception info here : http://s28.postimg.org/ra702djzh/crash.png

Surrounding the Wait call with try/catch fixes the problem but I don't think it's the right solution

Thanks!

data.title: Protobuild.exe virus?
data.body:
Hi.

I have tried to update the latest, hoping to get rid of the touch input bug (which freezes the entire game) and when i unarhived the datas, I got a notification from my avira antivirus that protobuild.exe contains an virus.

Here is a screen I made to show you:
http://imgur.com/rUsTZO1
